alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 10:50AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN BOUNDARY AND CENTRAL BONNER COUNTIES... At 950 AM PST, a snow squall was located near Bonners Ferry, moving southwest at 15 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this squall along with low visibility less than a half mile. Locations impacted include... Bonners Ferry, Naples and Elmira. This includes U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 486 and 510. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
